text:
MLP Model
Before we can ﬁt an MLP on this data, we must ﬂatten the shape of the input samples. MLPs
require that the shape of the input portion of each sample is a vector. With a multivariate input,
we will have multiple vectors, one for each time step. We can ﬂatten the temporal structure of
each input sample, so that:
[[10 15]
[20 25]
[30 35]]
Listing 7.20: Example input data for the ﬁrst data sample.
Becomes:
[10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35]
